metadata.titel_preek: Zählt nicht uns, sondern eure Tage

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of 'frozen eternity' and 'all-powerful delusion' (Allmachtswahn) to a state of 'wise heart' and 'lived solidarity' through the act of lament and prayer.

subject.identificatie: The Human/The 'We' (as a collective of 'little people' and 'God's servants')

object.identificatie: A 'Wise Heart' (Ein Herz von Weisheit) / The 'Home' (Heimat) in God
tekstueel_bewijs: damit wir einbringen ein Herz von Weisheit
Gott als die Heimat und als die Zukunft aller Menschen
Die Bibel versucht vielmehr, uns einen anderen Weg zu zeigen

ontvanger.identificatie: The suffering humanity / The 'poor children' / The 'servants'
tekstueel_bewijs: erbarme dich über die, die dir dienen
Sättige uns am Morgen mit deiner Solidarität
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: God's Solidarity / The Act of Lament (Klage)
tekstueel_bewijs: Gott flickt das zerrissene, verschlissene Leben
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (in the turning) and Helper (in the solidarity).

tegenstander.identificatie: Allmachtswahn (Delusion of Omnipotence) / The 'Megamachine' / Structural Sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal bad habits but a global, structural system of violence and ecological destruction (SDI, nuclear power, economic exploitation).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical work of liberation and preservation of the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The 'We' (as co-workers)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The work of our hands (Werk unserer Hände/Befreiung)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical work (Program 2) is only possible after the 'turning' of God and the acquisition of the wise heart (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Biblical Tradition → Wise Heart → Suffering Humanity

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott will uns an der guten Macht des Lebens beteiligen
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir bringen unsere Jahre zu wie ein Geschwätz

voorbeelden: wir müssen auch die Elenden in unser Herz lassen
Gott will uns an der guten Macht des Lebens beteiligen
damit wir ein weises Herz gewinnen
Wer an das Leben glaubt, braucht das Leben nicht herzustellen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) provided by God's solidarity, which breaks the false 'Pouvoir' of human omnipotence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S2 (Resignation) through S2 (Realizing the Wrath/Consequences) to S1 (Solidarity/Turning).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God's 'turning' (Umkehr) bridges the gap between the human condition and divine eternity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is interpreted as the logical consequence of structural sin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon has strong ethical demands, they are rooted in God's prior action of 'turning' and 'solidarity'. It avoids moralism by identifying the human problem as a 'delusion of power' that only God can break.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Call to action without explicit grace-foundation
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Noch dürfen wir jeden Tag bewusst als ein Geschenk Gottes annehmen

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the one who repairs life
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Gott flickt das zerrissene, verschlissene Leben.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Human passivity in the face of life-guarantee
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Wer an das Leben glaubt, braucht das Leben nicht herzustellen.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Moses is used as a model of the 'God-man' who can both lament and hope.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Moses is not a hero of will, but a hero of 'lament', which is a surrender of will.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the pressure of 'having to do everything' (Allmachtswahn).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is participation in God's life rather than achieving a standard.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Allmachtswahn' context to the Psalm's 'Klage' is masterfully handled.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God's wrath' and 'God's solidarity'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Gott will uns an der guten Macht des Lebens beteiligen.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'delusion' (Wahn) that leads to the destruction of the planet.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully moves the Subject from a false 'Agent of History' (Allmacht) to a 'Crying Receiver' (Klage), allowing God to become the true Subject of the 'Turning'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current Pouvoir (God's power) focus.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'counting of days' even more explicitly to the Spirit's work.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Allmachtswahn/Megamachine) is already very intense.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's turning) → Ethics (Work of our hands).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of political-theological homiletics that uses structural analysis to deconstruct modern idols while remaining deeply rooted in the biblical text.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Goethe and the 'Allmachtswahn' metaphor; semiotics reveals the underlying shift in agency (Subject-switch).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Hebrew of Psalm 90; semiotics focuses on how the sermon 're-scripts' the listener's role in the modern world.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps identify that 'Allmachtswahn' is a false Subject-position that prevents the listener from receiving the Object (Wisdom).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Klage' (Lament) as the functional bridge between human inability and divine action.
